Class CalculatorController

java.lang.Object
com.csaba79coder.calculator.controller.CalculatorController
public class CalculatorController extends Object
Controller class that handles user interactions and coordinates between the model and view using MVC pattern. Responsibilities: - Event handling for button clicks - Keyboard input processing - Coordinating Model and View updates - User interaction logic
Version:
1.0
Author:
Csaba79coder

  • Field Details

    • model

      private final Calculator model

    • view

      private final CalculatorFrame view

  • Constructor Details

    • CalculatorController

      public CalculatorController(Calculator model, CalculatorFrame view)
      Constructor - Initializes controller with model and view. Sets up all event listeners.
      Parameters:
      model - The calculator model (business logic)
      view - The calculator view (UI)

  • Method Details

    • initializeListeners

      private void initializeListeners()
      Initializes all event listeners for buttons and keyboard. This method sets up: - Number button listeners (0-9) - Operation button listeners (+, -, ×, ÷) - Special button listeners (=, C, ⌫, ., +/-, %) - Keyboard input listener

    • handleNumberInput

      private void handleNumberInput(String digit)
      Handles number button input (0-9). Appends digit to current number in the model.
      Parameters:
      digit - The digit to append (0-9)

    • handleOperationInput

      private void handleOperationInput(String operationSymbol)
      Handles operation button input (+, -, ×, ÷). Sets the operation in the model.
      Parameters:
      operationSymbol - The operation symbol

    • handleEquals

      private void handleEquals()
      Handles equals button (=). Calculates and displays the result. Shows error message if calculation fails (e.g., division by zero).

    • handleClear

      private void handleClear()
      Handles clear button (C). Resets calculator to initial state.

    • handleDelete

      private void handleDelete()
      Handles delete button (⌫). Removes last digit from current number. If only one digit remains, clears to zero.

    • handleDecimal

      private void handleDecimal()
      Handles decimal point button (.). Adds decimal point to current number if not already present.

    • handleSign

      private void handleSign()
      Handles sign toggle button (+/-). Changes the sign of the current number (positive ↔ negative).

    • handlePercent

      private void handlePercent()
      Handles percent button (%). Converts current number to percentage (divides by 100).

    • handleKeyPress

      private void handleKeyPress(KeyEvent e)
      Handles keyboard input. Supports: - Number keys (0-9) - Operation keys (+, -, *, /) - Enter/= for equals - Decimal point (. or ,) - Backspace for delete - Escape/C for clear - % for percent
      Parameters:
      e - The keyboard event

    • updateDisplay

      private void updateDisplay()
      Updates the display with current value from model. Called after every user action to keep UI synchronized.
